N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 77.3 - Applications for refunds and redemptions

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 475 and 476
(a) All applications for refunds and
redemptions must be in such form and contain such information as the Department
of Taxation and Finance shall require. All applications must be presented to
the department at the following address: Department of Taxation and Finance

Cigarette Tax Unit
W. A. Harriman Campus

Albany, NY 12227. (b) (1)

Every application must include a certification by or on behalf of the party
presenting the application, that: (i) such
application is just, true and correct; (ii)
no part of the claim has been previously
paid (except as otherwise stated therein); and
(iii)
that the balance shown is actually due
and owing. (2)

Every
application must also establish that the cigarette tax has been borne by the
applicant and that such tax is refundable or payable as described in this Part. The department may require such further information or proof of the application
for refund or redemption as it may deem necessary for the processing of such
application. No refund or redemption shall be paid unless the department is
satisfied that the amount of tax for which the refund or redemption is claimed
has actually been collected by or on behalf of the State. (c) See Part 2399 of this Title for mailing
rules and rules applicable to performing any act when the last day prescribed
for performing such act falls on a Saturday, Sunday or a day which is a legal
holiday in the State of New York. Notes
